verses.roman:
yāhā haite sunirmala dvitīya nāhi āra
tathāpi sarvadā vāmya-vakra-vyavahāra

synonyms: yāhā haite—than which; su-nirmala—very pure; dvitīya—second; nāhi—there is not; āra—another; tathāpi—still; sarvadā—always; vāmya—perverse; vakra—crooked; vyavahāra—behavior.
translation: "Nothing is purer than Her love. But its behavior is always perverse and crooked."
